Detailed Description

This class represents the derives-in-one and derives-in-many relationship between non-terminals.

For non-terminals A and B derives-in-one holds if B is on the RHS of the rule for A. derives-in-many holds if B can be dreived from A in one or more steps.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

bool GrammarLevels::areEquiv (  NonTerminal *  nt1,
NonTerminal *  nt2
) 
 

Return true if nt1 and nt2 are equivalent.

That is, nt1 can derive nt2 in one or more steps, AND nt2 can derive nt1 in one or more steps.

bool GrammarLevels::canDerive (  NonTerminal *  nt1,
NonTerminal *  nt2
) 
 

Return true if nt1 can derive nt2 in one or more steps.

int GrammarLevels::getDerivesInManyEdges (   )  [inline]
 

int GrammarLevels::getDerivesInOneEdges (   )  [inline]
 

void GrammarLevels::makeClosure (   ) 
 

Calculate the derives-in-many relationship by taking the transitive closure of the derives-in-one relationship.

Basically, keep adding transitive relationships until there are no more to add (fixpoint algorithm).

void GrammarLevels::setDerive (  NonTerminal *  nt1,
NonTerminal *  nt2
) 
 

Set the derives-in-one relationship from nt1 to nt2.

That is, nt2 has been found on the RHS of the rule for nt1.
